issue.title: world step fails to solve bilateral constraints

content.raw:
There is a dRecip to compute the reciprocal operation inside function dLCP::transfer_i_to_C inside step.cpp that cause the NaN. 
There is no check on when the denominator is numerically 0, which results in "Inf". The "Inf" is multiplied with another numerically 0, and cause the NaN.
content.html: There is a dRecip to compute the reciprocal operation inside function dLCP::transfer_i_to_C inside step.cpp that cause the NaN. There is no check on when the denominator is numerically 0, which results in "Inf". The "Inf" is multiplied with another numerically 0, and cause the NaN.
